column1: Automatic Generation of Leveled Visual Assessments for Young Learners

column4: Mourvi Sharma@Thank and Learn Pvt. Ltd.

column1: Images are an essential tool for communicating with children
column2: particularly at younger ages when they are still developing their emergent literacy skills. Hence
column3: assessments that use images to assess their conceptual knowledge and visual literacy
column4: are an important component of their learning process. Creating assessments at scale is a challenging task
column5: which has led to several techniques being proposed for automatic generation of textual assessments. However
column6: none of them focuses on generating image-based assessments. To understand the manual process of creating visual assessments
column7: we interviewed primary school teachers. Based on the findings from the preliminary study
column8: we present a novel approach which uses image semantics to generate visual multiple choice questions (VMCQs) for young learners
column9: wherein options are presented in the form of images. We propose a metric to measure the semantic similarity between two images
column10: which we use to identify the four options – one answer and three distractor images – for a given question. We also use this metric for generating VMCQs at two difficulty levels – easy and hard. Through a quantitative evaluation
column11: we show that the system-generated VMCQs are comparable to VMCQs created by experts
column12: hence establishing the effectiveness of our approach.
